intro: Draba longii, commonly known as the longleaf draba, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is a small, herbaceous annual or biennial plant characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and slender, branching stems. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Native to regions of central and eastern Asia, it thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in alpine or arctic environments. Draba longii is notable for its adaptability to harsh climates and its role in ecological succession in its native habitats.
